headline: Letter to the editor: Words give wrong impression of Dr. Oz event
sentences:
Mehmet Oz stumps in Westmoreland County in quest for U.S. Senate” (Jan. 26, TribLIVE): “The meet-and-greet event held in a small room … where few attendees wore face coverings, attracted about 265 people … .”
That number of people certainly couldn’t fit in a small room, sounds more like 25 or so.
I love how just a few words can give the wrong impression if one doesn’t read further!

Hempfield
Categories: Letters to the Editor | Opinion
Is the reporter trying to downplay the event?
Come on, tell it like it is!
